title: Sunny, showers to continue throughout the week
content: It will be pleasant and quiet tonight with showers and storms returning tomorrow, said Meteorologist McCall Vrydaghs.    >> WHIO Doppler 7 Live Interactive Radar    QUICK-LOOK FORECAST:   Quiet and mild night ahead  Showers and storms return Sunday  Less humid to start the week    >> 5-day forecast    Tonight:  Scattered clouds around through the evening and overnight. Temperatures will fall through the 70s with lows dropping to the mid 60s by morning. Some more clouds around towards daybreak as a cold front approaches from the west.    Sunday: Lots of clouds around to start the day with showers developing in the morning. This line of showers will push from west to east ending into the early afternoon. A few embedded storms are possible with heavier rain and gusty winds. Severe weather not expected. Clouds will break for sunshine for the rest of the afternoon and temperatures will reach the upper 70s. Skies continue to clear into Sunday night and cooling off into the middle 50s.    >> LISTEN: Cloudy with a chance of Podcast: A podcast for weather fans    Monday:  Mostly sunny, cooler and less humid for Monday. Temperatures will reach into the middle 70s.    Tuesday:  Sun and some clouds for Tuesday with the chance for showers and a few storms developing late. Highs expected around 80 degrees.    >> County-by-county weather      Wednesday:  A partly cloudy and warm day for Wednesday with highs in the upper 70s.    Thursday:  Partly sunny with the chance of a few showers or storms. Highs in the middle 80s.       Recommended for you    Recommended for you    Recommended for you
